name: Love, Partially Quiz | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: Add one letter to LOVE to make a piece of winter wear.
questions.explanation:
Glove.

	Gloves are like mittens, but your fingers can move around more.  Mittens have one slot for your four fingers and another for your thumb, but a glove has a spot for each of your fingers and thumbs separately, allowing for more movement.

questions.text: Add two letters to LOVE to find something that might be a lucky symbol.
questions.explanation:
Clover.

	During St. Patrick's Day, many kids will search through a field of three-leafed clovers in search of a four-leafed clover.  If you find one, you will supposedly have good luck.  The clover is also called a shamrock.

questions.text: Add four letters to LOVE to get a flying pet.
questions.correct: Lovebird & Love Bird & Lovedove & Love dove
questions.explanation:
Lovebird & Love Bird & Lovedove & Love dove.

	Lovebirds are from the family Psittaculini, a type of parrot.  They are in the genus Agapornis.  Lovebirds are birds; therefore, they fly.

questions.text: Add two letters to LOVE to make a type of wading bird.
questions.explanation:
Plover.

	Plovers are wading birds that live in fields and moors.  Wading birds usually have long, thin legs, and they like to walk around in shallow water.  They usually eat fish.  Other wading birds are herons, cranes, flamingos, and storks.

questions.text: Add 4 letters to LOVE to find an adjective meaning untidy or careless.
questions.explanation:
Slovenly & Sloven & Unlovely.

	Slovenly means untidy or careless in your work. Slovenliness means being untidy or careless in your work.  If you are sloven, you are untidy.

questions.text: Add a letter to LOVE to find a word meaning a piece of garlic or allspice.
questions.explanation:
Clove.

	Cloves are spices made from dried flower buds.  Allspice and anise are cloves.  Garlic also comes in cloves.

questions.text: Add two letters to LOVE to make a word meaning split.
questions.explanation:
Cloven.

	Cloven means split, as in a hoof.  For instance, a pig's hoof has two toes, therefore it is cloven.  A horse, however, only has one, so it is not cloven.

questions.text: Add four letters to LOVE to find a word meaning unhappy because of being in love.
questions.explanation:
Lovesick & Love sick&lovelorn.

	When you are lovesick, you are sad and depressed because of love.  For instance, if someone breaks up with you, you may feel very sad that they did that to you.  You would be considered lovesick.

questions.text: Add four letters to LOVE to make a word meaning a sweater put over the head.
questions.explanation:
Pullover & Pull over.

	A pullover is made of wool or some other fabric and is like a jacket.  It has a hood that you can pull over onto your head, which is why it is called a pullover.

questions.text: Add one letter to LOVE to find someone who is in love.
questions.explanation:
Lover.

	A lover is someone who loves or someone who is in love.  Although a lover can be both man and woman, it is usually a man.  For instance, Pepe Le Pew the skunk is considered a lover, because he is always looking for love, and is always in love with whomever he sees.
